comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: In Light Gull Gray and Insignia White scheme, Douglas AD-6 Skyraider 134531 with two under wing fuel tanks and chocked wheels on an airfield apron under cloudy skies. Aircraft designation AD-6 and full Navy number 134531 below horizontal tailplane. Date of picture unknown. Aircraft belonged to VA-15 ‘Valions’ with Modex 514 on engine cowl and tail code AB of Carrier Air Group / Wing One (CVG-1 / CVW-1). VA-15 served with CVG-1 / CVW-1 from 1949 to 1964/65. After September 1962 all AD-6 were redesignated A-1H. Picture of A-1H Skyraider 134531: groups.yahoo.com/group/PropNavy/attachments/folder/196721... 134531 NH-505 A-1H VA-115 at NAS Lemoore no date After retirement from the US Navy and storage, this A-1H Skyraider was one of many overhauled modified, repainted and acquired for service in South East Asia. A-1H 134531 was transferred to the Vietnam Air Force (VNAF) of the then Republic of South Vietnam but its fate is as yet unknown. Probably lost in the war or captured by the invading North Vietnamese 1973-1975.
